sentence.Network_en: There is always a lifeguard to ensure that no one comes to any harm.
sentence.Network_cn: 总是有一个救生员在场以确保无人受到伤害。

sentence.Network_en: I applied for a job as a lifeguard at the community pool.
sentence.Network_cn: 我申请了社区游泳池的救生员工作.

sentence.Network_en: I could pay you back out of my lifeguard salary.
sentence.Network_cn: 我可以从我当救生员的薪水中拿出来还你.

entry.def: A lifeguard is a person who works at a beach or swimming pool and rescues people when they are in danger of drowning.

means.word_mean: 1. an attendant employed at a beach or pool to protect swimmers from accidents

auth_sentence.content: The tall lifeguard stand threw a short shadow.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tall lifeguard stand threw a short shadow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tall lifeguard stand threw a short shadow.

auth_sentence.content: Where no lifeguard is on duty, the FCO advises against swimming.
auth_sentence.res_content: Where no lifeguard is on duty, the FCO advises against swimming.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Where no lifeguard is on duty, the FCO advises against swimming.

auth_sentence.content: Lifeguard Edmir Nicacio Lopes Junior was just steps away when a woman was attacked.

sentences.en: The lifeguards must be trained to deal with any sort of emergency.
sentences.cn: 救生员一定要接受训练,学会应付各种紧急情况。
